channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: All street light are out, 29th December
item.description:
All the street lights are out on Mottingham Road from Court Road up to the Prince of Wales again ! It’s very dark & scary !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tennis street, 29th December
item.description:
There are food packaging, plastic bottles, plastic bags and cans on Tennis Street. It is dirty and unsightly. The litter has been there for four days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tennis Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: Litter near planters on Tabard street, 29th December
item.description:
There is a rubbish bag, food packaging and clothes dumped at the planters on Tabard Street. The items are still there despite fixmystreet stating it was removed. Please can it cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish piling up AGAIN!, 29th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchill Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of dog fouling on Webber row, 29th December
item.description:
There is someone with a large dog who consistently fails to pick up after their dog. I do not know where this person lives but they have been observed once by my parter and she felt too intimidated by the size of dog to say anything. Further, I just now saw 3 dogs running around on Webber row with nobody seemingly in charge. My guess is that someone, rather than walking their dog, just lets them out. They were big dogs, and one was of course fouling the pavement. This is becoming a problem and is probably just down to one person being inconsiderate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Row, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
